newLineKind.description: The kind of newline to use.

oneOf.description: For each file, uses the newline kind found at the end of the last line.
Uses the system standard (ex. crlf on Windows).

emphasisKind.description: The character to use for emphasis/italics.

strongKind.description: The character to use for strong emphasis/bold.

unorderedListKind.description: The character to use for unordered lists.

oneOf.description: Uses dashes (-) as primary character for lists.
Uses asterisks (*) as primary character for lists.

headingKind.description: The style of heading to use for level 1 and level 2 headings. Level 3 and higher always use ATX headings.

oneOf.description: Uses # or ## before the heading text (ATX headings).
Uses an underline of = or - beneath the heading text (setext headings). Only applies to level 1 and 2 headings.

listIndentKind.description: The style of indentation to use for list items. CommonMark aligns to the content column after the marker. PythonMarkdown uses a fixed 4-space indent, required by tools like mkdocs-material.

oneOf.description: Indents continuation lines to align with the content after the list marker (e.g. 3 spaces for '1. ', 4 for '10. ').
Always indents by 4 spaces, regardless of marker width.

deno.description: Top level configuration that sets the configuration to what is used in Deno.

locked.description: Whether the configuration is not allowed to be overridden or extended.

lineWidth.description: The width of a line the printer will try to stay under. Note that the printer may exceed this width in certain cases.

ignoreDirective.description: The text to use for an ignore directive (ex. `<!-- dprint-ignore -->`).

ignoreFileDirective.description: The text to use for an ignore file directive (ex. `<!-- dprint-ignore-file -->`).

ignoreStartDirective.description: The text to use for an ignore start directive (ex. `<!-- dprint-ignore-start -->`).

ignoreEndDirective.description: The text to use for an ignore end directive (ex. `<!-- dprint-ignore-end -->`).

tags.description: Custom tag to file extension mappings for formatting code blocks. For example: { "markdown": "md" }

additionalProperties.description: The file extension to use when formatting code blocks with this tag.
